Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a fish in its natural water habitat.
The student can label the fish and the water as part of the drawing.
The student can include and label other aquatic plants or animals that live in the same environment as the fish.
The student can label the resources the fish needs to survive, like water and food.
The student can show and label how the fish uses its habitat to meet its needs (e.g., swimming in water, finding food).
The student can demonstrate understanding of the relationship between the fish and the resources in its habitat through labels and connections.
